result.execSummary:
The defendant William J Hildenbrand was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: **COURT ORDERED PROBATION REVIEW HEARING IN BR. 4 ON 7-17-2015 AT 1:30PM**

miscConds.notes:
Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, DNA surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections, during period or probation or CIVIL JUDGMENT.

**Restitution is set at zero**

No firearms; weapons.
48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

No drugs.
No alcohol.
No violent contact with victim, under the following conditions:
Defendant must have a mental health examination and cooperate with any treatment or medication. Defendant must complete at least 12 sessions of BIP.
May not reside in the home without permission of the court, Agent and Wife.

Attend and successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
Attend and complete parenting classes.
Allowed out of home contacts less than 10 hours per week.
Supervised 3rd party contact for the purpose of time with children as approved by agent. Mother may supervise but not in the family home.

Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
Random urine screens and breathalyzer test
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant William J Hildenbrand in court.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  DOC agent Nicole Williams also in court.
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.   mld
addressed to the court, dated 5-5-2015, from Impact, received and filed.   mld

Defendant William J Hildenbrand in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
AS TO AMENDED COUNT #1 and COUNT #2: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.    Courts finds that State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Kristen H. 

AS TO AMENDED COUNT #1: Defendant sentenced to serve 3 MONTHS (CONSECUTIVE to count 2), in the House of Correction with credit for 2 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 YEARS. 

AS TO COUNT #2: Defendant sentenced to serve 9 MONTHS (CONSECUTIVE to count 1), in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 YEARS. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
* Court ordered the defendant to serve 45 DAYS
   in the House of Correction.  Stayed pending review.
* Attend and successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling.
* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Attend and complete parenting classes.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No violent contact with victim, under the following conditions: 
  Defendant must have a mental health examination and 
  cooperate with any treatment or medication.  Defendant must 
  complete at least 12 sessions of BIP.  
  Must maintain absolute sobriety.  May not reside in the home 
  without permission of the Court, Agent and Wife.  
  Allowed out of home contacts less than 10 hours per week.  
* Supervised 3rd party contact for the purpose of time with
   children as approved by agent.  Mother may supervise
   but not in the family home.  
* Obtain and maintain employment.
* No firearms; weapons.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence
   surcharge, DNA surcharge, and supervision fees as 
   determined by the Department of Corrections, 
   during period of probation or CIVIL JUDGMENT.
* Restitution is set at zero.
**COURT ORDERED PROBATION REVIEW HEARING IN BR. 4 ON 7-17-2015 AT 1:30 PM. 
48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
 Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  
Pretrial Incarceration Credit (not provided by defense counsel).  mld

Defendant William J Hildenbrand in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court AMENDED the Charge of COUNT #1 to Disorderly Conduct (Domestic Abuse), Contrary to Wisconsin State Statute(s) 947.01(1) and 968.075(1)(a) a Class B Misdemeanor."   mld
from Justice Point, received and filed.   mld

Court amended the no contact order to allow parties contact by telephone for the purposes of moving children back and forth.  Parties may not discuss the case.  Defendant may be present in the home to make repairs when the victim and children are not present.   mld

Victim, Kristen H., appeared to request modification of the no contact order.  Court amended the no contact order to allow parties contact by telephone for the purposes of moving children back and forth.  Parties may not discuss the case.  Defendant may be present in the home to make repairs when the victim and children are not present.   mld

Defendant William J Hildenbrand in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense withdraws request by defendant (via letter dated 2-19-2015) for new representation.  Discovery received by defense counsel.  Parties are negotiating an offer.  Case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 4-10-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld
from Justice Point, received and filed.   mld

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by  portable breathalyzers.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Kristen H. or her residence. Third party contact for purposes of seeing children in common is approved by the court.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

ADDRESS INFO for William J Hildenbrand

Prior: 4841 North Navajo Ave, Glendale, WI 53217

Defendant William J Hildenbrand in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  
Defendant William J Hildenbrand in custody.  
Gary D. Mahkorn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
UPON RELEASED DEFENDANT WILL NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
Scheduling conference scheduled for March 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
